title: [BUG] Prophet wrapper internally changing argument X (exogenous data)
body:
> **Describe the bug**

When fitting prophet with exogenous data, the wrapper changes the argument `X` resulting in some issues; you can't use the same variable X as argument twice since it'll contain the column name `ds` after the first run, so you need to create copies at each occurence. 
It gets worse when you do a `fit_predict` since the X changes internally (because of `fit`), when `fit_predict` calls `predict`, it raises an error that you can't work around with copies.

**To Reproduce**

```python
from sktime.forecasting.fbprophet import Prophet
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

y_train = pd.Series(np.arange(1,21), index=pd.date_range(start='1/1/2021', end='20/1/2021'))
X_train = pd.DataFrame(data=np.arange(1,21), columns=['something'], index=pd.date_range(start='1/1/2021', end='20/1/2021'))

arima_forecaster = Prophet()
arima_forecaster.fit_predict(fh=y_train.index, y=y_train, X=X_train)
print(X_train)
```

> **Traceback**
```
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-30650cb58dc7> in <module>()
      7 
      8 arima_forecaster = Prophet()
----> 9 arima_forecaster.fit_predict(fh=y_train.index, y=y_train, X=X_train)
     10 print(X_train)

3 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/adapters/_fbprophet.py in _merge_X(df, X)
    197     X.columns = X.columns.astype(str)
    198     if "ds" in X.columns:
--> 199         raise ValueError("Column name 'ds' is reserved in fbprophet")
    200     X.loc[:, "ds"] = X.index
    201     # df = df.merge(X, how="inner", on="ds", copy=False)

ValueError: Column name 'ds' is reserved in fbprophet
```

> **Expected behavior**

to fit and predict without changing arguments so that it can fit_predict without error
